title: Time To Pack Our Bags As Brazil President Has Just Said Indians Won't Have To Pay Visa Fees
text:
Time To Pack Our Bags As Brazil President Has Just Said Indians Won't Have To Pay Visa Fees

Time To Pack Our Bags As Brazil President Has Just Said Indians Won't Have To Pay Visa Fees

In a welcome move, Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro said the South American nation will drop its requirement that visiting Chinese and Indian tourists or businesspeople obtain visas.

Bolsonaro, a far-right politician, came to power at the beginning of the year and has made it a policy to reduce visa requirements from a number of developed countries. But the announcement, made during an official visit to China, is the first he has made expanding that policy to the developing world.

AFP

Earlier this year, the Brazilian government ended visa requirements for tourists and businesspeople from the United States, Canada, Japan and Australia. Those countries, however, have not in return dropped their visa requirements for Brazilian citizens.

In August last year, Thailand extended the visa fees waiver for Indian tourists until April 2020.

The waivers are part of a $10 billion stimulus package to boost growth, including a debt moratorium for farmers, loans for smaller businesses, and more money for low-income earners.

"The cabinet approved the extension of fee waivers until April 2020," Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha told reporters, adding that the scheme would cover Lunar New Year and the Thai new year, Songkran.

The fee of 2,000 baht ($65) is to be waived until next year for travellers from 18 countries, including China and India.
